page.title: 18L.B.Plastics at Nether Heage
page.content: { L.B.Plastics}was originally Litchfield Brothers of Broadholme and the firm dates back to the 1930's.It made wire parts and metal pressings. After the Second World War the Broadholme Factory developed an idea to make more things like thermo- plastics and this worked well.Because it developed so rapidly a separate company was formed in 1956 called{L.B. {Plastics Ltd.}and it moved to a new site at{Nether Heage.} It is well placed in the centre of the U.K.near to Derby and the Motorway It has offices and factories in Sweden Swiwzerland,Australia,U.S.A.and the Far East. The P.V.C.is used for windows,carrying electric wire through buildings and a knitted mesh. It is used in the home for clothes lines, draught excluders,door springs,curtain rails and hooks.
